projects.description: I practiced my knowledge of basic JavaScript syntax and data structures by building a Random Quote Generator, a program that displays a randomly selected quote each time the user clicks a button

Displaying a long list of items on a web page, like a list of 200 movie titles or 400 products, can overwhelm a user with too much information at once. A common solution is to display a handful of items on one page and provide navigation to jump to a list of more items. In this project, I wrote JavaScript to divide a long list into a series of pages and improve the user experience of a web page.

Full Stack JavaScript developers create forms to collect information from users for nearly every website and application they build. For this project, I used my skills in jQuery and JavaScript to enhance a form so that it’s engaging, interactive, and easy to use.

In this project, I have created a browser-based, word guessing game: Phrase Hunter. I've used JavaScript and OOP (Object-Oriented Programming) to select a random, hidden phrase. A player tries to guess the phrase by selecting individual letters from an onscreen keyboard. Can they guess the phrase before they run out of attempts?

Many sites — Twitter, Facebook, IMDB, and Wikipedia to name a few — offer a vast sea of data that you can access and display on your own web pages. Using JavaScript and jQuery, I've created an employee directory by communicating with a third-party API (Application Programming Interface).
